results.title: The Dentist
results.brief_description: A Mack Sennett comedy, starring W.C. Fields as an irascible and unconventional dentist who performs entertaining antics on the golf course and in his dental offices.

results.title: The Demanding sea
results.brief_description: A record of life at sea. Two old sailors discuss their lives against a background of moving ships - frigates, tramps, liners, tankers, trawlers and tugs - and the sea, in all its moods, benign, stormy and ice-bound. Conveys an awareness of what the sea means.

results.title: The Delinquent, the hipster and the square
results.creator_credit: Tim Kiley, Jack Kuney and CBS Television
results.brief_description: A study of the dynamics of youth culture as expressed in dominant youth reactions to the world; rebellion, escape and uncritical acceptance. Each reaction is examined dramatically and the significance pointed out critically, yet sympathetically, by the narrator Dr. William Kirkland, late professor of Christian Ethics, McCormick Theological Seminary. Written by Elliot Baker. Starring Warren Berlinger as the square, William Hickey as the delinquent, Pat DeSimone as the girl, Mal Throne as the poet and the Max Roach Quinter.

results.title: The Defensive driver
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safe Driving”.
A father who accompanies his son on a short drive observes that his son is a safe driver who anticipates dangerous situations and drives defensively in order to avoid accidents. Father and son discuss driving hazards which require alertness and courtesy, as well as skill, on the part of drivers: overcrowded areas, complicated traffic lights, pedestrians, emergency vehicles, road signs, grade crossings, and student drivers.

results.title: The Deep frontier
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The 21st Century”.
An exploration of the ocean floor in a diving bell submarine that takes divers to an underwater residence for aquanauts. Among other devices shown are a four-story laboratory, a submarine with wheels and a remote controlled recovery robot. Interviews by Walter Cronkite with specialists in this area of research, including Jacques Cousteau, are featured also.

results.title: The Decline of the Roman Empire
results.brief_description: Uses actual settings in France, England, the Near East and Rome to present the political, social and economic forces which weakened the Roman Empire from within and the forces from without which brought about its decline.

results.title: The Declaration of independence by the colonies
results.creator_credit: John T. Bobbitt and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Describes events and circumstances which lead to the American Declaration of Independence. Recalls the Boston Tea Party; the clash of British troops at Lexington and Concord; First and Second Continental Congresses held at Philadelphia; “Common Sense”, the pamphlet written by Tom Paine, which worked a change in public opinion toward British rule; Jefferson’s drafting of the Declaration of Independence and its adoption on July 4th, 1776.

results.creator_credit_for_label: John T. Bobbitt and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: The Decision to drop the bomb
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: The Manhattan Project, the making of the first atomic bomb. History of the making of this weapon, the political background, the war situation in 1945 and the final testing in New Mexica. Also includes the meeting at Potsdam where Churchill, Stalin and Truman discussed the European situation and the war with Japan. Truman advised Stalin that a secret weapon of some magnitude had been made. The decision to drop the bomb on Hiroshima was carried out while Truman was returning to the United States. Reporter: Chet Huntley.
